sen.j: 裏切りの原因については、勝頼との対立の他に、かつての武田義信によるクーデター事件が関係しているとも（弟信邦は義信側に味方したことにより自害）、妻の見性院が諏訪氏の血を引く勝頼よりも、自らが生んだ穴山信治（勝千代）の方が武田家当主に相応しい（信治は武田氏の血を3/4継いでいる）と夫に勧めたためだとも言われるが、いずれにせよ確証はない。
sen.e: As for the reason for the betrayal, in addition to conflicts with Katsuyori, some say the coup incident by Yoshinobu TAKEDA played a role (his brother, Nobukuni, took sides with Yoshinobu, leading to suicide), or because his wife, Kenshoin, suggested to her husband that instead of Katsuyori, who is of the Suwa clan's blood, Nobuharu ANAYAMA (Katsuchiyo), to whom she gave birth, is more suitable as the head of the Takeda family (Nobuharu is three quarters Takeda clan's blood), but they all lack conclusive evidence.

sen.e: For betraying Katsuyori at the last minute despite being a Takeda family member, he has negative reputation alongside Yoshimasa KISO, who was also the son-in-law of Shingen, but switched sides to the Oda family, and Nobushige OYAMADA, who betrayed right before the fall, but on the other hand, Hachiro SATO gives him favorable appraisal, justifying his decision of daring to turn away to sustain the family name, while Toshifumi YANO believes that the relationship between the Takeda clan and kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) such as Anayama and Oyamada was a coalition government, and that with the fall, he broke away from a kobetsu ryoshu (individual feudal lord) point of view.
